info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 1:43PM MDT until July 29 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SOLDIER CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN OTERO COUNTY... At 143 PM MDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Soldier Canyon Burn Scar. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Soldier Canyon and locations downstream in Mescalero. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Soldier Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Soldier Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mescalero and Soldier Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Soldier Canyon Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
